author: dapplion
content:
About altair `process_sync_aggregate` https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/altair/beacon-chain.md#sync-aggregate-processing

To get the root that the sync committee singed for it's fetched with
```python
previous_slot = max(state.slot, Slot(1)) - Slot(1)
signed_root = get_block_root_at_slot(state, previous_slot)
```

Two questions:
- Can a block at slot 0 be ever processed? If no, why is this condition there? For completeness?
- For slot > 0 is `get_block_root_at_slot(state, previous_slot)` any situation in which is not equal to `block.parent_root`?

author: nishant0
content:
> - Can a block at slot 0 be ever processed? If no, why is this condition there, for completeness?
How I  look at it is that it is basically overflow protection, for any consensus operation dealing with subtraction, the same conditions are used too.

author: nishant0
content:
> For slot > 0 is get_block_root_at_slot(state, previous_slot) any situation in which is not equal to block.parent_root
Off the top of my head, it should always be referencing the parent block due to how blocks roots are stored in the state(even in the presence of skipped slots).
